movies.title: Alisa v strane chudes
movies.plot: Alice follows the white rabbit, falls down a deep hole and discovers a strange Wonderland at the bottom.
movies.simplePlot: Alice follows the white rabbit, falls down a deep hole and discovers a strange Wonderland at the bottom.

biography.placeOfBirth: Leningrad, Russian SFSR, USSR [now St. Petersburg, Russia]
biography.bio: Marina Neyolova was born on January 8, 1947 in Leningrad, Russian SFSR, USSR [now St. Petersburg, Russia] as Marina Mstislavovna Neyolova. She is an actress, known for Marathon d'automne (1979), Le barbier de Sibérie (1998) and Alisa v strane chudes (1981).
biography.name: Marina Neyolova

biography.bio: Georgiy Kishko is an actor, known for Treasure Island Part I: Captain Flint's Map (1986), Treasure Island Part II: Captain Flint's Treasure (1988) and Strakh (1980).
biography.name: Georgiy Kishko

biography.placeOfBirth: Tula, Moskovskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR [now Tulskaya oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Vyacheslav Nevinny was a Russian actor of Moscow Art Theatre (MKhAT). He was born Vyacheslav Mikhailovich Nevinny on November 30, 1934, in Tula, Russia, Soviet Union (now Tula, Russia). Young Nevinny was fond of theatre, he was active in amateur drama club at Palace of Pioneers in Tula, and made his stage debut with Tula Theatre. From 1955 - 1959 he studied acting under Viktor Stanitsyn at Moscow Art Theatre School of Acting, graduating in 1959 as an actor. In 1960 he made his film debut in Ispytatelnyy srok (1960) by director Vladimir Gerasimov. From 1959-2009 Vyacheslav Nevinny was a permanent member of the troupe at Moscow Art Theatre (MKhAT). There his stage partners were such renown Russian actors as Anatoli Ktorov, Olga Androvskaya, Angelina Stepanova, Nikolay Khmelyov, Mikhail Yanshin, Aleksei Gribov, Boris Livanov, Mikhail Kedrov, Mark Prudkin, Anastasiya Georgiyevskaya, Vasili Toporkov, Mikhail Bolduman, Pavel Massalsky, and the next generation of MKhAT actors - Oleg Efremov, Tatyana Doronina, Innokentiy Smoktunovskiy, Oleg Tabakov, Kristina Babushkina, Alla Pokrovskaya, Kira Golovko, Iya Savvina, Nina Gulyaeva, Elena Panova, Darya Moroz, Olga Litvinova, Natalya Rogozhkina, Ekaterina Semenova, Olga Yakovleva, Anastasiya Voznesenskaya, Irina Miroshnichenko, Evgeniya Dobrovolskaya, Andrey Myagkov, Stanislav Lyubshin, Vladimir Kashpur, Viktor Sergachyov, Evgeniy Kindinov, Vladimir Krasnov, Dmitriy Nazarov, Sergey Sazontev, Avangard Leontev, Igor Vasilev, Igor Vernik, Sergei Sosnovsky, Mikhail Porechenkov, Konstantin Khabenskiy, Valeri Khlevinsky, Valeriy Troshin, Mikhail Trukhin, Eduard Chekmazov, Aleksey Kravchenko, Aleksei Agapov, and Evgeniy Mironov among others. His best known stage appearances include his roles in such classic plays as Nikolai Gogol's Revizor (aka.. Inspector-General) and in Anton Chekhov's plays: Ivanov, Chaika (aka.. The Seagull), Dyadya Vanya (aka.. Uncle Vanya), and Vishnevy sad (aka.. The Cherry Orchard). Vyacheslav Nevinny was designated People's Actor of the USSR, and received a congratulatory note from the Russian president. He was suffering from diabetes with complications causing him amputation of both legs. However, Nevinny was supported by his family as well as by his fellow actors, such as Aleksandr Kalyagin and Sergey Yurskiy among many others. Nevinny was married to actress Nina Gulyaeva, their son, Vyacheslav Nevinnyy is also an actor at Moscow Art Theatre. He died at his home in Moscow on May 31, 2009, of complications related to diabetes, and was laid to rest in Troekurovskoe Cemetery in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Vyacheslav Nevinnyy

biography.placeOfBirth: Nizhnyaya Tura, Sverdlovsk Oblast, Russian SFSR, USSR [now Russia]
biography.bio: Evgeniy Papernyy was born on September 3, 1950 in Nizhnyaya Tura, Sverdlovsk Oblast, Russian SFSR, USSR as Evgeniy Vasilevich Papernyy. He is an actor, known for Treasure Island Part I: Captain Flint's Map (1986), Night Is Short (1982) and Vykup (1994).
biography.name: Evgeniy Papernyy

biography.placeOfBirth: Rostov-on-Don, Don Voisko Oblast, Russian Empire [now Rostov Oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Rostislav Plyatt was born on December 13, 1908 in Rostov-on-Don, Don Voisko Oblast, Russian Empire as Rostislav Yanovich Plyatt. He was an actor, known for Delovye lyudi (1962), Kak lvyonok i cherepakha peli pesnyu (1974) and Zhenikh s togo sveta (1958). He died on June 30, 1989 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Rostislav Plyatt

biography.bio: Aleksandr Shirvindt was born on July 19, 1934 in Moscow, Russian SFSR, USSR as Aleksandr Anatolyevich Shirvindt. He is an actor and director, known for Ironiya sudby, ili S legkim parom! (1975), Ironiya sudby. Prodolzhenie (2007) and Bezumnyy den ili zhenitba Figaro (1974).
biography.name: Aleksandr Shirvindt

biography.bio: Tatyana Vasileva was born on February 28, 1947 in Leningrad, USSR as Tatyana Grigoryevna Itsykovich. She is an actress, known for Zakrytaya shkola (2011), Uvidet Parizh i umeret (1992) and Samaya obayatelnaya i privlekatelnaya (1985). She is married to Anatoliy Vasilev. They have one child. She was previously married to Georgiy Martirosyan.
biography.name: Tatyana Vasileva

biography.bio: Rina Zelyonaya was born on November 7, 1901 in Tashkent, Russian Empire as Yekaterina Vasilyevna Zelyonaya. She was an actress and writer, known for Operation 'Y' & Other Shurik's Adventures (1965), The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1981) and Vovka v Tridevyatom tsarstve (1965). She died on April 1, 1991 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Rina Zelyonaya
